sections.subtitle: Building A Vibrant Digital Showcase
paragraphs: In my experience as a software engineer, the desire to build a space that truly encapsulates my professional journey, achievements and the spectrum of projects I've passionately worked on led me to design and launch this very site.
It was to be a showcase of some of my more recent and favorite work, offering a window for peers, potential collaborators and the curious to explore the work that fuels my joy for this field.

sections.subtitle: How It Works
paragraphs: The Client Application is a React/Next.js app hosted on Vercel. The deployment is embedded within the Monday platform, along with interactive boards that display the order/product information dynamically populated by the API.

When the user initiates an order using the Client; changes the status of an order; or adds/edits/deletes a product offering, webhooks within Monday are triggered, sending the data to the API (hosted on Heroku). The API then leverages the ORM to perform CRUD via T-SQL Stored Procedures executed within the SQL Server database. The data displayed on the Monday boards is also mutated, ensuring consistency.

sections.subtitle: Technology Stack
paragraphs: The client app is built on React and Next.js, with Monday's Vibe Design library for custom components and Tailwind CSS for layout. The server is built using Node/Express, and leverages various tools to perform robust database CRUD while ensuring efficiency and security.
The Client Application is hosted on Vercel, the API on Heroku and  SQL Server database on Microsoft Azure. This deployment stack was chosen for its speed, security, reliability and ease of use.
